description.raw:
Runs in gui-less BLACS tab.

Card parameters are configured in connection table. 

Assumes a single acquisition during a shot.

Acquires to RAM, subsequently writes to H5 file, so is limited by available RAM.

Currently only supports triggered acquision, where one trigger prompts recording of pre-defined sample duration.

Record channel A, or channels A&B, but not channel B only. No code yet for cards with other than 2 channels.

Saves to H5 as raw samples and as floating point in volts.

Saves metadata as attributes in devices section, but largely encodes metadata at ATS API bitfields rather than transparent scientific quantitites.

Substantial debugging output on BLACS console.

Recovers from aborts successfully and continues.

Promptly throws exception leading to red-text traceback in both BLACS-tab windows, if the trigger is not received by the end of the shot \(transition-to-manual time\).
description.html:
Runs in gui-less BLACS tab.

Card parameters are configured in connection table.

Assumes a single acquisition during a shot.

Acquires to RAM, subsequently writes to H5 file, so is limited by available RAM.

Currently only supports triggered acquision, where one trigger prompts recording of pre-defined sample duration.

Record channel A, or channels A&B, but not channel B only. No code yet for cards with other than 2 channels.

Saves to H5 as raw samples and as floating point in volts.

Saves metadata as attributes in devices section, but largely encodes metadata at ATS API bitfields rather than transparent scientific quantitites.

Substantial debugging output on BLACS console.

Recovers from aborts successfully and continues.

Promptly throws exception leading to red-text traceback in both BLACS-tab windows, if the trigger is not received by the end of the shot (transition-to-manual time).

title.raw: Support for AlazarTech data acquisition cards (ATS9462 and potentially others)
title.html: Support for AlazarTech data acquisition cards (ATS9462 and potentially others)
